title: Tesla: The $4 Trillion Target Is A Red Flag
text: Elon Musk said on Tesla's earnings call that Tesla would come to be worth more than Apple and Saudi Aramco combined. Going by today's valuations, this statement implies a greater than $4 trillion valuation.

title: Tesla: Q3 Earnings Showed Immense Strength In An Impossible Environment
text: Tesla is the world's leading electric vehicle manufacturer, with a mission "to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy". Shares have been cut in half from their 52-week highs, following a difficult year for all investors in fast-growing businesses.

title: Tesla Q3: Assessing Elon Musk's Execution Ability Objectively
text: Elon Musk never fails to pull his PR stunts, and this Q3 earnings report is no exception. The Tesla thesis, to a large degree, is a Musk thesis. Bears and bulls seem to disagree more fiercely on him than anything else.

title: Cathie Wood Picks Up $13M In Tesla Shares As Investors React Negatively To Q3 Earnings
text: Cathie Wood-led ARK Investment Management has bought over 66,000 shares of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) at a valuation of over $13 million, based on Thursday's closing price, via the company's flagship

title: Is Tesla Stock Back in Value Territory?
text: The price of Tesla ( TSLA , Financial) stock has been on a downward spiral in 2022. Some of the hard-core Tesla bulls might insist this is purely due to inflation and rising interest rates, or the general stock market downturn, but the truth is that the stock was ridiculously overvalued near its all-time highs.

title: Why Tesla Stock Fell Today
text: The EV leader couldn't meet the market's sky-high expectations.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla will be bigger than Apple. Analysts say not so fast
text: Elon Musk sees Tesla Inc. becoming bigger than the combined valuation of Apple Inc. and Saudi Aramco one day. Wall Street is saying, not so fast.

title: Tesla shares skid after Musk flags recession in China, Europe
text: Tesla's stocks declined after Elon Musk said they would miss their annual delivery target because of supply chain issues as well as recessions in Europe and Asia.

title: Why Is NIO Stock Up Today as TSLA Stock Falls 6%?
text: The gains in Nio (NYSE: NIO ) have all but evaporated on Thursday, as shares were up 4.7% at one point on the day. NIO stock was enjoying a surprising rally despite notable losses in Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ), which then dragged down other electric vehicle (EV) stocks.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Pulls Off 7th Consecutive Beat in Q3 Earnings
text: While Tesla (TSLA) manages to maintain its beat streak in Q3 despite industry challenges, its revenues fall short of the consensus mark.

title: What's Going On With Lucid Stock Following Tesla's Earnings Report - Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA)
text: Lucid Group Inc (NASDAQ: LCID) shares are trading lower by 1.94% to $12.40 Thursday afternoon, potentially amid overall market weakness and following peer EV-maker Tesla's third-quarter earnings report.

title: Analyst blasts Elon Musk for his attitude on the earnings call
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) is trading down this morning after the electric vehicles manufacturer said it will fail to deliver on its promise of a 50% growth in deliveries this year.

title: Nio stock bounces, even after Tesla CEO Elon Musk says China seeing 'burst of recession'
text: The U.S.-listed shares of China-based Nio Inc. NIO, +0.02% gained 0.1% in afternoon trading Thursday, after closing the previous session at the lowest price since July 2020, despite the 6.7% selloff in rival electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc.'s stock TSLA, -7.05% after disappointing third-quarter results. Meanwhile, shares of fellow China-based EV makers XPeng Inc. XPEV, +3.39% climbed 3.9% after closing Wednesday at a record low, and Li Auto Inc. LI, +2.68% hiked up 3.0% after closing Wednesday at a two-year low.

title: Tesla: Q3 Revenue Miss, But The Long-Term Story Is Spectacular
text: Tesla is the world's largest EV maker, which also has thriving solar, energy storage, and potentially even a robotics business in the future. The company missed Q3 revenue estimates, but has produced record revenue across all its business units.

title: 3 Key Takeaways From TSLA Stock's Q3… and What to Expect Next
text: After markets closed yesterday, Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ) reported earnings for the third quarter of 2022. After spending the month on a steady downward trajectory, TSLA stock needed a positive catalyst.

title: Tesla is flirting with its first-ever share buyback - and it's a signal the company thinks its stock is undervalued
text: CEO Elon Musk told analysts late Wednesday that Tesla was considering a share buyback of $5 billion to $10 billion.

title: Tesla Q3: Mixed Quarter, Musk Pumps, Mr. Market Dumps
text: Tesla's Q3 report proved to be underwhelming, with a slight beat on EPS being overshadowed by misses on revenue and automotive gross margins. Not a surprise considering Q3 deliveries data. Elon Musk provided a lot of hopium during the earnings call, going as far as saying that Tesla could be worth more than Apple and Saudi Aramco combined ($4.5 trillion).

title: 7 EV Stocks to Buy During a Stock Market Crash
text: Though electric vehicles may be the future, the market doesn't see it that way at the moment, with several EV stocks suffering from the current market rout. Nevertheless, astute and daring investors may want to target this sector for speculative (and long-term) acquisitions.

title: Tesla Q3 results: Five things you may have missed including self-driving EVs
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) earnings updates are always full of many moving parts for its legion of investors on both sides of the Atlantic to chew over - and this week's was no different In terms of top-level numbers earnings impressed, but then the shares tanked today - with a lot more going on beneath the surface at Elon Musk's electric vehicle star. 1 . Self-driving EVs behind schedule Having originally expected its advanced driver assistant software to gain regulatory approval in 2022, but Musk has now admitted it would not be able to satisfy authorities that its cars can be driven without someone behind the wheel before the year-end.

title: Tesla Stock Drops on Earnings Release: 7 Key Metrics You Should See
text: In early trading on Thursday, investors seemed to be overly focused on the EV giant's third-quarter revenue falling a little short of Wall Street's expectation.

title: Tesla shares slide after Q3 revenue miss, Bernstein says earnings call 'didn't sit well with us'
text: Shares of Tesla fell Thursday after the electric vehicle maker missed analyst's revenue estimates.

title: Tesla Stock Sinks on Revenue Miss, Slashed Delivery Target
text: Electric vehicle (EV) giant Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is sinking today, last seen down 7.2% at $206.04, after its better-than-expected third-quarter earnings results came along a revenue miss.

title: 'This quarter was not rainbows and roses': Wall Street reacts to Tesla's mixed 3rd-quarter earnings report
text: "We remain cautious on valuation, particularly in the context of lofty unit volume growth expectations, and continue to see material downside risk."

title: Tesla Stock Slides After Revenue Miss, Musk Maintains Optimism
text: Tesla is facing headwinds from supply chains but results continued to improve at a rapid pace during the quarter, which could lead to the stock heading higher.

title: Tesla falls as Elon Musk warns about demand after 3rd-quarter revenue misses forecasts
text: Tesla stock was lower Thursday, a day after the company reported lackluster earnings. Chief executive Elon Musk noted concerns over demand.

title: Why Is Tesla (TSLA) Stock Down Today?
text: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ) stock fell almost 6% overnight after the company missed revenue expectations for its third quarter. For the three months ending in September, Tesla saw net income of $3.33 billion and earnings per share of 95 cents on revenue of $21.45 billion.

title: Musk says Tesla expects to meet Inflation Reduction Act requirements for new tax credits on EVs
text: To be eligible for the credit, the car's battery must meet a minimum threshold of parts sourced from the U.S. or a select set of countries.

title: Tesla's Growth Is Back on Track. Is It Time to Buy?
text: Tesla still expects to hit its 50% annual growth production target this year.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla could buy back up to $10 billion in shares next year
text: "It's certainly possible for us to do a buyback on the order of $5 billion to $10 billion, even in the downside scenario next year," Elon Musk said.

title: Tesla Shares Drop In Pre-Market After Missed Q3 Earnings
text: Despite missing earnings estimates, Musk was optimistic about Tesla, expecting the company to continue to grow deliveries by 50% year over year.

title: Elon Musk: “Tesla Could Be Worth More Than Apple And Saudi Aramco Combined” As Q3 Revenue Target Misses
text: Tesla have announced their Q3 numbers and, unsurprisingly, the most noteworthy aspect to the results has been comments from Elon Musk.

title: Tesla Bigger Than Apple and Saudi Aramco Combined? Dream on, Investors Tell Musk.
text: Elon Musk says Tesla can eclipse the combined value of Apple and Saudi Aramco, the world's most valuable companies. The market thinks that's ludicrous.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla's value could soar 6-fold to over $4.4 trillion, Twitter might be worth $400 billion, and the Fed should cut interest rates. Here are his 10 best quotes from Tesla's Q3 earnings call.
text: The Tesla CEO teased up to $10 billion of stock buybacks next year, rang the deflation alarm, and distanced himself from Warren Buffett.

title: Elon Musk can be like a 'toddler' having a 'tantrum,' Tesla's former marketing chief said. 'I was seeing this person that was taken by anger.
text: Colette Bridgman told a new BBC documentary that Musk apologized after yelling at her for a third time, but she still decided to leave the company.

title: U.S. stock futures dip as Treasury yields hit fresh 14-year highs, Tesla stock tumbles post results
text: U.S. stock futures pulled back on Thursday as investors warily eyed Treasury yields climbing to fresh 14-year highs. Also dragging tech stocks was a sharp drop in Tesla Inc. shares after disappointment over results.
